summary: This is a formal letter from the law firm Steptoe & Johnson LLP, on behalf of Jeffrey Epstein's estate, to the FBI's New York Field Office. It requests specific documents and records from the Department of Justice related to Epstein's death in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 10, 2019, citing concerns about irregularities at the facility.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died in federal custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 10, 2019, from an apparent suicide.
Epstein's estate, through its attorneys, is formally requesting specific evidence from the DOJ/FBI for a period covering August 9-10, 2019, to investigate the circumstances of his death.
The request cites serious concerns about 'irregularities' at the MCC, referencing public statements by Attorney General William Barr.
The New York City Office of Chief Medical Examiner initially delayed releasing a determination on the cause of death, citing a need for 'further information.'
The document is a formal FOIA-style request made under 28 C.F.R. §§ 16.21-16.26 by legal counsel authorized by Epstein's estate.
